direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve querying interest-related data, though nextHourlyInterestRate focuses on future estimations while interestHistory deals with historical records.
Both methods access and manipulate margin account data, specifically related to interest and repayments, which are closely related financial operations.

The nextHourlyInterestRate method may depend on the maximum borrowable amount, which is queried by the maxBorrow method, especially when calculating future interest rates based on potential borrowings.
Both methods access and manipulate margin account data, with account providing a broader overview of the account, which can be useful for context when estimating future interest rates.
Both methods involve querying interest rate data, with interestRateHistory providing historical data that can be useful for predicting future rates in nextHourlyInterestRate.
